ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Classes and methods for spatial objects that have a registered time column, in particular for irregular spatiotemporal data. The time column can be of any type, but needs to be ordinal. Regularly laid out spatiotemporal data (vector or raster data cubes) are handled by package 'stars'.

Classes and methods for spatial objects that have a registered time column, in particular for irregular spatiotemporal data. The time column can be of any type, but needs to be ordinal. Regularly laid out spatiotemporal data (vector or raster data cubes) are handled by package 'stars'.

name: r-sftime
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-sftime
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/sftime_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/sftime/sftime_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d1df6a2f611059e1949a3b2ef75ec5310e7cca4289dcf7af369197f4d5c68874

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-sf >=1.0.7
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-sf >=1.0.7

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('sftime')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('sftime')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=sftime
  license: Apache-2.0
  summary: Classes and methods for spatial objects that have a registered time column, in particular for irregular spatiotemporal data. The time column can be of any type, but needs to be ordinal. Regularly laid out spatiotemporal data (vector or raster data cubes) are handled by package 'stars'.
  license_family: APACHE
  license_file:
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
